sentences.en: Below us you could glimpse the rooftops of a few small villages.
sentences.cn: 我们可以瞥见脚下一些小村庄的屋顶。

sentences.en: Crowds shouted and pushed to get a glimpse of their hero.
sentences.cn: 为了一睹英雄的风采，人群喊叫着，推搡着。

sentences.en: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他一眼瞥见她在人群里。

sentences.en: He caught a glimpse of the man's face in a shop window.
sentences.cn: 他在商店橱窗里瞥见了一眼那个人的脸。

sentences.en: He'll sit you in front of his computer and give you a glimpse of the problem.
sentences.cn: 他会让你坐到电脑前，大致了解一下这个问题。

sentences.en: I caught a momentary glimpse of them.
I glimpsed a figure at the window.
I got a glimpse of the mountain as the ship went by.
sentences.cn: 在行船中我瞥见了那山.

sentences.en: I had a glimpse of his true feelings.
sentences.cn: 我窥见到他的真实感情.

sentences.en: One glimpse at himself in the mirror was enough.
sentences.cn: 让他照着镜子看自己一眼就够了.

sentences.en: People swarmed over the pavements, trying to catch a glimpse of the President's car.
sentences.cn: 人们云集在人行道上, 想看一眼总统的车.

sentences.en: She catches a glimpse of a car in the distance.
sentences.cn: 她一眼就瞥见了远处的汽车.

sentences.en: Some of the fans had waited 24 hours outside the hotel to catch a glimpse of their heroine.
sentences.cn: 某些追星族为了一睹女杰的风采已在宾馆外守候了24小时。

sentences.en: Some of the fans had waited 24 hours outside the Hyde Park Hotel to catch a glimpse of their heroine.
sentences.cn: 为了一睹女主角的风采，一些追星族已经在海德公园饭店外守候了24个小时。

sentences.en: The girls caught only a fleeting glimpse of the driver.
sentences.cn: 女孩们只匆匆瞥了一眼司机。

sentences.en: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.cn: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

sentences.en: This is my glimpse of New York.
sentences.cn: 这就是我对纽约的一瞥所见.

sentences.en: Through the window I caught a glimpse of a large but simply furnished room.
sentences.cn: 从窗口我瞥见一间宽敞但陈设简单的房间.

words.tran_cn: 微弱地发光的；薄弱地发光的

trans.tran_en: a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly
to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
